thread.title: Sensex gains 29 points in early trade amid mixed trends in Asia
thread.title_full: Sensex gains 29 points in early trade amid mixed trends in Asia

title: Sensex gains 29 points in early trade amid mixed trends in Asia
text:
| Updated: Aug 07, 2015 10:16 IST 
The benchmark BSE Sensex advanced nearly 29 points in opening trade on Friday on some buying by foreign funds and retail investors amid mixed trends in Asian markets. 
The 30-share barometer rose 28.98 points, or 0.10% to 28,327.11. The gauge had gained 226.20 points in the past two sessions. Stocks of metal, oil and gas, healthcare and auto sectors led the gains. 
On similar lines, the NSE Nifty also advanced 5.40 points or 0.06% to 8,594.05. 
Brokers said buying by foreign funds and retail investors amid mixed trends at other Asian markets mainly influenced sentiments. 
In other Asian markets, Hong Kong's Hang Seng rose 0.22% while Japan's Nikkei fell by 0.28% in early trade on Friday. 
The US Dow Jones Industrial Average, however, ended 0.69% lower in Thursday's trade. Tags
